meanings.definition: A piece of absorbent cloth or paper used for drying or wiping.
meanings.sent1: I always keep a clean towel in the bathroom for drying my hands.
meanings.sent2: She grabbed a towel to dry off after swimming in the pool.
meanings.sent3: The towel slipped off the hook and landed on the wet floor with a plop.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a comforting towel in the storm of life.
meanings.sent5: The colorful towel hung on the line, swaying gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To dry or wipe with a towel.
meanings.sent1: He towels his hair vigorously after a shower to get it dry quickly.
meanings.sent2: After washing the car, she carefully towels it to make it shine.
meanings.sent3: The puppy playfully tried to towel off its wet fur with a dishcloth.
meanings.sent4: She towels away the tears of sadness with a smile of hope.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly towels the excess oil off the fried chicken, making it crispy.
